column1:
Dear Students,

 

Reference is made to the earlier email notifications regarding Re-Examination schedule for (Sem IV & VI) Practical & DTM Viva Voce.

 

The detailed Re-examination schedule of Practical Examinations of Sem IV, VI & DTM 001 Viva Voce of various batches of B.Tech are attached herewith for your reference.

 

Note: Venue details will be displayed for DTM Viva Voce on the Notice board at the day of the Examination.

 

Instructions to Students:

1) Students are advised to be in formals.

2) All Students are required to report as per the above-mentioned schedule.

3) Softcopy of the DTM/ IIP/ Project Report as well as PPT should be submitted to Head of Department (HoD).

4) Hardcopies of the DTM/ IIP/ Project Report should also be submitted to HoD.

5) DTM/ IIP/ Project Viva-Voce will be conducted through OFFLINE mode only.

 

The Schedule of penalty for Malpractice cases is also attached for your information.

 

Kindly make note of the same and prepare well for the upcoming examination.

 

Best Wishes

 

Ravi Kiran

Deputy Registrar (Examination & Evaluation)
Alliance University

Dear Students,

 

Reference is made to the earlier email notifications regarding Re-Examination schedule for (Sem IV & VI) Practical & DTM Viva Voce.

 

The detailed Re-examination schedule of Practical Examinations of Sem IV, VI & DTM 001 Viva Voce of various batches of B.Tech are attached herewith for your reference.

 

Note: Venue details will be displayed for DTM Viva Voce on the Notice board at the day of the Examination.

 

Instructions to Students:

1) Students are advised to be in formals.

2) All Students are required to report as per the above-mentioned schedule.

3) Softcopy of the DTM/ IIP/ Project Report as well as PPT should be submitted to Head of Department (HoD).

4) Hardcopies of the DTM/ IIP/ Project Report should also be submitted to HoD.

5) DTM/ IIP/ Project Viva-Voce will be conducted through OFFLINE mode only.

 

The Schedule of penalty for Malpractice cases is also attached for your information.

 

Kindly make note of the same and prepare well for the upcoming examination.

 

Best Wishes

Dear Students,

 

Greetings from the Centre of Excellence: Computer Vision, Alliance University!

 

We are delighted to inform you that the Centre of Excellence: Computer Vision, School of Advanced Computing, Alliance university in technical collaboration with the Proglint Software Solutions is organizing six weeks internship on the following:

 

Level 1: Machine Learning Models

Level 2: Computer Vision

 

The internship will be held at Alliance University's Anekal Campus, Bengaluru, from June 10th to July 19th, 2024. Six weeks’ internship program equips BE / B. Tech. / MCA / M. Tech. students with a solid foundation in Machine Learning (ML) principles and practical skills. Over six weeks, interns will delve into core concepts, explore diverse algorithms, and gain hands-on experience building and evaluating ML models / computer vision. Intern will be guided to write a good research paper which shall be published in international journals / conferences / patents.

 

Selection Procedure: Through online interview.

 

Highlights:

Blended Mode
Internship Certificates
Research paper publications guidance
Industrial exposures
Study material
 

Limited Seats: Student shall be offered internship based on their performance in the interview. Selected students will be intimated for fee payment.

Internship Fee:           

INR 2000/- (for Alliance University)
INR 2500/- (other Indian Students)
$100.00 (for International Students)

 

Apply here: 

  

 

Last date to register: 6 May 2024

 

Internship Coordinator:  

Dr. Ramalakshmi K, Director, COE Computer Vision

Dr. Virendra Kumar Shrivastava, Professor, COE- Computer Vision 

Dr. Gnanaprakasam T, Professor, COE- Computer Vision

 

Organizing Secretary:  

Dr. Revathi T., Assistant Professor, Computer Vision  

Email: revathi.t@alliance.edu.in

Dr. Saswati Debnath, Assistant Professor, COE- Computer Vision

Email: saswati.debnath@alliance.edu.in

 

 

Thanks and regards,

 

Dr. Virendra Kumar Shrivastava

Professor, Department of Computer Science & Engineering

Alliance College of Engineering & Design
Alliance University

P:  +91 80-4619 9152

Dear All,

 

We are pleased to share that Fly91, a scheduled domestic Airline in India operating on select routes is offering Alliance University students, faculty, and staff a 10% discount on their base fare as a promotional offer.

 

FLY91 is a regional airline operating a fleet of state-of-the-art ATR 72 – 600 Aircrafts. Launched in March 2024, they are currently operating more than 300 flights per month connecting 7 cities – Goa (North Goa Mopa), Bangalore, Hyderabad, Pune, Jalgaon, Sindhudurg and Agatti.

 

As a student or employee of Alliance University, you may avail a discounted fare as per the terms below:

 

Offer: 10% DISCOUNT on Base Fare

 

Applicability & Validity: On all flights across sectors of Fly91 from the June 1, 2024 till July 31, 2024; Offer valid for maximum of 2 persons per booking, however, can be used multiple times.

 

Mode of availing the offer:  Application of a coupon code “FLY91ALLIANCE“ at the time of booking online on their website http://www.fly91.in

 

For more details, please refer to the attachments.

 

Disclaimer: This mail is purely to communicate a promo offer by the airline for Alliance University members. This communication is intended to inform the students, faculty and staff of the offer and does not constitute an endorsement or recommendation by Alliance University. You may note that Alliance University has no legal, financial, operational, accidental, or health related obligation related to any members using the airline for travel through the promo offer or even otherwise. Any dispute arising out of travel by Fly91 or its affiliates / partners either through the offer or otherwise will be subject to the legal procedures of the Airline only.

 

 

Happy Flying!!!

 

Department of Student Support Services

Alliance University

P: +91 80-4129 9365/9297

Hi ananthvijay,

Youâ€™re now part of the worldâ€™s largest data science community. Welcome, weâ€™re glad youâ€™re here!

Whether youâ€™re new to machine learning or a renowned expert, we want to support you with powerful tools and resources to help you grow as a data scientist.

So, whereâ€™s the best place to start?

We highly recommend trying out our popular Titanic competition. Youâ€™ll be challenged to predict which passengers survived the infamous 1912 shipwreck.

Get Started Here
Itâ€™s a quick way to get a strong grasp of how our platform works. Youâ€™ll become more familiar with how our notebooks (online coding environment with no cost GPUs), open datasets, and open pretrained models work together to help you build data science projects.



Your agreement with Kaggle

About your Kaggle Account

A Kaggle Account allows you to access a range of Kaggle services, such as notebooks, datasets, and machine learning competitions.

Terms of Use

The Kaggle Terms of Use help to define the relationship between you and Kaggle. They describe what you can expect from using Kaggle services and what we expect from you. Kaggle services are provided by and you have a contract with:

Kaggle Inc.
1600 Amphitheatre Parkway
Mountain View, California 94043
United States of America
support@kaggle.com

You can use your Kaggle Account for an unlimited time. That means that the contract doesnâ€™t end automatically, but you can terminate it when you want.

Right of withdrawal

If youâ€™re an EEA-based consumer, your contract with Kaggle is by law subject to an automatic right of withdrawal for 14 days from the date of the conclusion of the contract. To exercise the right of withdrawal, you must inform us of your decision to withdraw from this contract by an unequivocal statement (e.g. a letter sent by post or an e-mail). You can find contact details in the Kaggle Terms of Use. You donâ€™t need to give a reason for your withdrawal and your withdrawal is within the deadline if you send us the withdrawal request before the withdrawal period expires.

This is an automated message.*
A SVM-based classification model is proposed to work as a prediction function. This function takes Wi-Fi parameters both for target AP and nearby interference APs as input, and output is categorized Wi-Fi throughput, good, medium, poor or very poor. Di errant SVM kernel functions conducted to evaluate the proposed model and results show that classification accuracy can be up to 0.88. It demonstrates that Wi-Fi throughput could be classified using a simple measurement way and limited Wi-Fi physical parameters. As a prediction function, an SVM-based classification model is suggested.

Dear Students,

 

Greetings from the Centre of Excellence: intel- High Performance Computing (HPC)..!

 

We are delighted to inform you that the Centre of Excellence: High Performance Computing, School of Advanced Computing, Alliance university is organizing a FOUR-week internship on HPC.

 

Intel High Performance Computing (HPC) encompasses a range of cutting-edge technologies and solutions designed to address the computational needs of today's most demanding capacities. At its core, Intel's HPC initiatives are focused on pushing the boundaries of performance, scalability, and efficiency to unlock new possibilities in scientific research, engineering simulations, artificial intelligence, and more. Intel's HPC offerings span across hardware, software, and services, delivering a comprehensive ecosystem tailored to meet the diverse requirements of HPC applications. On the hardware front, Intel provides a range of processors, accelerators, memory solutions, and storage technologies optimized for HPC workloads. This includes high-performance CPUs featuring advanced architectures, such as Intel Xeon Scalable processors, as well as specialized accelerators like Intel Xe GPUs and FPGAs, designed to accelerate specific computational tasks.

 

Program Structure: 

Level 1: Fundamentals of Computing, Algorithms and Essential Mathematics

Level 2: Parallelism in Computers and Computing: Theory, Algorithm Design & Applications

Level 3: Project-Based Learning

 

Venue:

The internship will be held at Alliance University's at LT108 from June 25th to July 20th, 2024. For online delegates, the link will be shared upon successful registration.   

 

Intended Audience:

Six weeksâ€™ internship program is especially designed for:

Â·         BE / B. Tech. / MCA / M. Tech./ MSc students having keen interest in computing and mathematics.

Â·         Exceptional and early career researchers (PhD) who are looking for research opportunities in the field of HPC.

 

Pre-requisites:

Basic mathematics (Class 12 level), Fundamentals of C/C++

 

Learning Outcomes:

Over six weeks, interns will delve into

Â·         core concepts of algorithms, computer architecture, and data structures.

Â·         essential of mathematics required for HPC (matrix algebra, numerical methods, optimization).

Â·         writing code for HPC, performing parallel computations.

Â·         applications of HPC, learning through mini-projects, and writing research papers. 

 

The course can further help you in finding remarkable opportunities in industry and IT sectors as System Engineer/ Analyst/ Computational Engineer. For early career researchers, the course will give you opportunity to link various global researchers in HPC.

Dear All,

 

We are pleased to share that Fly91, a scheduled domestic Airline in India operating on select routes is offering Alliance University students, faculty, and staff a 10% discount on their base fare as a promotional offer.

 

FLY91 is a regional airline operating a fleet of state-of-the-art ATR 72 â€“ 600 Aircrafts. Launched in March 2024, they are currently operating more than 300 flights per month connecting 7 cities â€“ Goa (North Goa Mopa), Bangalore, Hyderabad, Pune, Jalgaon, Sindhudurg and Agatti.

 

As a student or employee of Alliance University, you may avail a discounted fare as per the terms below:

Applicability & Validity: On all flights across sectors of Fly91 from the June 1, 2024 till July 31, 2024; Offer valid for maximum of 2 persons per booking, however, can be used multiple times.

Dear Students,
 

On account of the ongoing semester end examinations and request coming in from many of you to provide more space for studies, the Campus Estate Services team in consensus with other departments of the University has decided the following to facilitate more study zones across the campus:

 

The entire first floor of the food court on Central Campus would be available as reading space.
The first floor in the food court would be open as study zone to you between 4:00 pm and 9:30 pm.
No F&B (Food & Beverage) would be either served or be allowed to be carried to the first floor during the mentioned time.
You would be expected to treat the facility during the mentioned hours as reading hall that ensures silence and mutual study time for all.
Do treat the facility only for studies and not for loud discussions or meet-ups.
Any act of using the reading space for other activities unless approved or planned otherwise would be treated as misconduct.
 

The above announcement comes into effect immediately until further notice.

 

We encourage you to utilize the additional study zones most productively and wish you best for the remaining of the upcoming exams.

 

 

Best!
